document.title: Mathematics Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools

8B217739CC864665A341553AE5D821AB.description:
Identify a numerical value(s) that is part of the solution set of a given inequality in one
variable.

4A9A6262BB1E4AD69FB41A11329E7F9E.description:
Use substitution or a number line graph to justify whether a given number in a specified set
makes a linear inequality in one variable true.

ED9976EE7CE84408A8491A3BB5D33FC5.description:
Given a linear inequality in one variable, create a corresponding contextual situation or create
a number line graph.

A0DCCF4D165A4660BDED9496C22BA595.description:
Write a linear inequality in one variable to represent a given constraint or condition in context
or given a graph on a number line.

B9F2304A8F624D739F2452AEF36ED8E9.description:
Given the graph of a linear inequality in one variable on a number line, represent the
inequality in two equivalent ways (e.g., x < -5 or -5 > x) using symbols. Symbols include <, >,
≤, ≥.

32D60E805C384305A6F4CD702AC7311C.description:
The student will represent a contextual situation using a linear inequality in one
variable with symbols and graphs on a number line.

44F4F465F5ED4B90824235D0E70FE0C1.description: Create a verbal situation in context given a one-step linear equation in one variable.

9991155AC25846C0BCE03DF63DBE2ECA.description:
Write a one-step linear equation in one variable to represent a verbal situation, including those
in context.

93B9E97FD6F246CD95102DF5B6F66D4C.description:
Confirm solutions to one-step linear equations in one variable using a variety of concrete
manipulatives and pictorial representations (e.g., colored chips, algebra tiles, weights on a
balance scale).

9A5ABC6B40B34DECAC9F447638B875F6.description:
Apply properties of real numbers and properties of equality to solve a one-step equation in
one variable. Coefficients are limited to integers and unit fractions. Numeric terms are limited
to integers.

B4C79CAEDDE044CBBBBFC60ED415E925.description:
Represent and solve one-step linear equations in one variable, using a variety of concrete
manipulatives and pictorial representations (e.g., colored chips, algebra tiles, weights on a
balance scale).

7EB10B9F847E4F45A8BA202FDE729F5E.description:
Identify and develop examples of the following algebraic vocabulary: equation, variable,
expression, term, and coefficient.

9CCFF7D17F5649A7ABC4C2CE788370BE.description:
The student will write and solve one-step linear equations in one variable, including
contextual problems that require the solution of a one-step linear equation in one
variable.

1A5B50599FCB40118EDBC72910003AC6.description:
Make connections between and among multiple representations of the same proportional
relationship using verbal descriptions, ratio tables, and graphs.

C417434B997D48739497AB0CC5BA2336.description:
When given a contextual situation representing a proportional relationship, find the unit rate
and create a table of values or a graph.

45C6EE3CF7C640539AA5EF3CBE9B1E56.description:
Determine whether a proportional relationship exists between two quantities, when given a
table of values, context, or graph.

79DC13143B404F07B0DB10E451259DE3.description:
Determine a missing value in a ratio table that represents a proportional relationship between
two quantities using a unit rate.

C210D2888E64482A9F42D5D4897D11C3.description:
Identify the unit rate of a proportional relationship represented by a table of values, a
contextual situation, or a graph.

E691706BD39E41BC828067908AFE1A0F.description:
The student will identify and represent proportional relationships between two
quantities, including those in context (unit rates are limited to positive values).

EF02EFA73BD14A739BE0B3DF5DFE4C24.description:
Create a table of equivalent ratios to represent a proportional relationship between two
quantities, when given a contextual situation.

EC1BA2106BE042F3851952F275499F19.description:
Create a table of equivalent ratios to represent a proportional relationship between two
quantities, when given a ratio.

A4DD7BEBC5014EB78E912B933548C858.description: Create a relationship in words for a given ratio expressed symbolically.

D084DB64AADE4E2CBC7E724A5B7E191C.description:
Represent different comparisons within the same quantity or between different quantities
(e.g., part to part, part to whole, whole to whole).

86075985D510467790A1861C557C6160.description:
Represent a relationship in context that makes a comparison by using the notations 𝑎
𝑏
, a:b, and
a to b.

4EB5F94CAEFD46E5BA91D907786BAD92.description: Represent a relationship between two quantities using ratios.

0E2CB842D51F4CFE9F885F21F278A1E8.description:
The student will use ratios to represent relationships between quantities, including
those in context.

F21E1E0F254A4B39A17418C578285664.description:
Observe patterns in data to identify outliers and determine their effect on mean, median,
mode, or range.

0956D7D1AECF44ADBA41C46684E55EBD.description:
Determine the effect on measures of center when a single value of a data set is added,
removed, or changed.

0248117395E64788A76EAE341C6E8461.description:
Represent the mean of a set of data graphically as the balance point represented in a line plot
(dot plot).

84E7B0DE2D13493FA8A83D4D5C27CA08.description:
The student will represent the mean as a balance point and determine the effect on
statistical measures when a data point is added, removed, or changed.

7BB483670E3C4DA78553671E8EE6EBEF.description:
Compare data represented in a circle graph with the same data represented in other graphs,
including but not limited to bar graphs, pictographs, and line plots (dot plots), and justify
which graphical representation best represents the data.

6B5686D4256849329E2CDB70663F6B5B.description: Analyze data represented in a circle graph by making observations and drawing conclusions.

7448D58026DF407199DE15737439EF12.description:
Organize and represent data using circle graphs, with and without the use of technology tools.
The number of data values should be limited to allow for comparisons that have denominators
of 12 or less or those that are factors of 100 (e.g., in a class of 20 students, 7 choose apples as
a favorite fruit, so the comparison is 7 out of 20, 7
20
, or 35%).

7BCD28F9E7FC4D5BA9BE4E312C8D3E80.description:
Determine the factors that will ensure that the data collected is a sample that is representative
of a larger population.

A09F092A97BE4936BDE51A1349E8C6D6.description:
Determine the data needed to answer a formulated question and collect the data (or acquire
existing data) using various methods (e.g., observations, measurement, surveys, experiments).

22F3F4D7252444D0A99587E95942D607.description:
Formulate questions that require the collection or acquisition of data with a focus on circle
graphs.

6053AD1DE3984E229578D3EF7A88268F.description:
Determine whether polygons are congruent or noncongruent according to the measures of
their sides and angles.

97FF98E6203E4CCFAA295B2749D4D7C6.description: Determine the congruence of segments, angles, and polygons given their properties.

CD0A3ECEC3D34C2096D7CE6980C0B287.description: Draw lines of symmetry to divide regular polygons into two congruent parts.

4F9945F60A034AFB9249499BF9C8CE37.description: The student will determine congruence of segments, angles, and polygons.

13B0E9ACFC2A4F189FCDA95D960E0C7B.description:
Draw polygons in the coordinate plane given coordinates for the vertices; use coordinates to
determine the length of a side joining points with the same first coordinate or the same second
coordinate. Ordered pairs will be limited to coordinates expressed as integers. Apply these
techniques in the context of solving contextual and mathematical problems.

C4E2FCF3DE9049C3A25D5059C922DECC.description:
Relate the coordinates of a point to the distance from each axis and relate the coordinates of a
single point to another point on the same horizontal or vertical line. Ordered pairs will be
limited to coordinates expressed as integers.

4012CC2133E04394A00C4336051D0917.description:
Identify ordered pairs represented by points in the four quadrants and on the axes of the
coordinate plane. Ordered pairs will be limited to coordinates expressed as integers.

78BD335BAC6445909CFE45AABDE8C2BF.description:
Graph ordered pairs in the four quadrants and on the axes of a coordinate plane. Ordered pairs
will be limited to coordinates expressed as integers.

B520B933E948475BA7037386288E9646.description:
Identify and describe the location (quadrant or the axis) of a point given as an ordered pair.
Ordered pairs will be limited to coordinates expressed as integers.

5F32AC2833754A48B8332D3B109DD565.description: Identify and label the axes, origin, and quadrants of a coordinate plane.

0B39487721484DF98BD832442F8EDDA3.description:
The student will describe the characteristics of the coordinate plane and graph ordered
pairs.

484723A9B7F648CFA6F2A73C93099DD0.description:
Solve problems, including those in context, involving the perimeter and area of triangles and
parallelograms.

A7BE5FB76202491E833FD4A2C470A384.description:
Develop the formula for determining the area of parallelograms and triangles using pictorial
representations and concrete manipulatives (e.g., two-dimensional diagrams, grid paper).

AC5B56A3636242E48236773F6E216DD1.description:
The student will reason mathematically to solve problems, including those in context,
that involve the area and perimeter of triangles and parallelograms.

287E452D693F4AE5A8CDF748AE7E06F1.description:
Solve problems, including those in context, involving circumference and area of a circle when
given the length of the diameter or radius.

DC638767535443A5A3218C517EDCE0AB.description:
Develop the formula for circumference using the relationship between diameter, radius, and
pi.

32F030AB561C493F91A175B4F831597C.description:
Develop an approximation for pi (3.14) by gathering data and comparing the circumference to
the diameter of various circles, using concrete manipulatives or technological models.

68D4314B344D432B85E464FA3AE1993E.description: Investigate and describe the relationship between diameter and circumference

9B70E27EEF684A4DB72BCEBC94103A6E.description: Investigate and describe the relationship between radius and circumference

42BB59CBAB504B518E1CABC444B623CE.description: Investigate and describe the relationship between diameter and radius

2D788EE7FF514F97B096A6D06ACF5334.description: Investigate and describe the relationship between:

1028FCA25C6C471590CBB88A812C3C5A.description: Identify and describe chord, diameter, radius, circumference, and area of a circle.

A16E741D69754F95B529DB0AE1218F6C.description:
The student will identify the characteristics of circles and solve problems, including
those in context, involving circumference and area.

C703D269E89242B694EAE8FDB7C8BF7B.description:
Estimate, determine, and justify the solution to one and two-step contextual problems,
involving addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division with integers.

104B6498A6EA446C9B4756AB5154F184.description:
Simplify an expression that contains absolute value bars | | and an operation with two integers
(e.g., –|5 – 8| or
|−12|
8
) and represent the result on a number line.

DA838495426A455A83F28E147977B07D.description: Add, subtract, multiply, and divide two integers.*

629311CCB25B4B55B0481105016CF0E1.description:
Demonstrate/model addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division of integers using
pictorial representations or concrete manipulatives.*

38CE213D1D1F41CE9C4BC109C00561CC.description:
The student will estimate, demonstrate, solve, and justify solutions to problems using
operations with integers, including those in context.

531340680FAB43BFBDA37ADC63220458.description:
Estimate, determine, and justify the solution to single-step and multistep problems in context
that involve multiplication and division with fractions (proper or improper) and mixed
numbers that include denominators of 12 or less. Answers are expressed in simplest form.

2128A9DB463E4588AB7AEB4E42CCE42A.description:
Estimate, determine, and justify the solution to single-step and multistep problems in context
that involve addition and subtraction with fractions (proper or improper) and mixed numbers,
with and without regrouping, that include like and unlike denominators of 12 or less. Answers
are expressed in simplest form.

ED1C04EE73254F7B8D7C57ADF6FB94DB.description:
Investigate and explain the effect of multiplying or dividing a fraction, whole number, or
mixed number by a number between zero and one.*

88E50405C8364843980BD7D85E84822A.description:
Multiply and divide fractions (proper or improper) and mixed numbers that include
denominators of 12 or less. Answers are expressed in simplest form.*

34AA53171D6341F0B2FAD98290CF9D03.description:
Demonstrate/model multiplication and division of fractions (proper or improper) and mixed
numbers using multiple representations.*

D60879BDEA1D43058BB6DDD174F1943D.description:
The student will estimate, demonstrate, solve, and justify solutions to problems using
operations with fractions and mixed numbers, including those in context.

820AFC3FD1014D6FB382FB06FB1EBACE.description:
Recognize and represent powers of 10 with whole number exponents by examining patterns in
place value.

DD41F7D222964302A197FD7784E4B56D.description:
Justify if a number between 0 and 400 is a perfect square through modeling or mathematical
reasoning.

8E967DD40B7C4D678BF3241511B2579F.description:
Recognize and represent patterns of perfect squares not to exceed 202
, by using concrete and
pictorial models.

061BA40531F54F38B9F6389BA3323E4F.description: Recognize and represent patterns with bases and exponents that are whole numbers.

3725352FDFA147C9BCE375BD6403BE07.description:
The student will recognize and represent patterns with whole number exponents and
perfect squares.

B968F568DE204E9B9FE6419FCFF47C43.description:
Identify and describe the absolute value of an integer as the distance from zero on the number
line.

EAE23246720C454D9FE66A3461667ECD.description: Compare and order integers using a number line.

449D3E1A120D42EB9ED3DC968EFFEA1C.description:
Represent integers (e.g., number lines, concrete materials, pictorial models), including models
derived from contextual situations, and identify an integer represented by a point on a number
line.

F33B87EF318B4DC9980F9FC68875EAD2.description:
The student will reason and use multiple strategies to represent, compare, and order
integers.

C5684C3968814F9C857D4DB09824EA36.description:
Use multiple strategies (e.g., benchmarks, number line, equivalency) to compare and order no
more than four positive rational numbers expressed as fractions (proper or improper), mixed
numbers, decimals, and percents (decimals through thousandths, fractions with denominators
of 12 or less or factors of 100) with and without models. Justify solutions orally, in writing or
with a model. Ordering may be in ascending or descending order.*

351878DC97C94D16BF2ECE27827384A7.description:
Represent and determine equivalencies among decimals, percents, fractions (proper or
improper), and mixed numbers that have denominators that are 12 or less or factors of 100
incorporating the use of number lines, and concrete and pictorial models.*

9EA32D6B65F24933856295094F64A59F.description:
Represent and determine equivalencies among fractions (proper or improper) and mixed
numbers that have denominators that are 12 or less or factors of 100 and percents
incorporating the use of number lines, and concrete and pictorial models.*

01203666A96949118FACB0064435DE64.description:
Represent and determine equivalencies among decimals (through the thousandths place) and
percents incorporating the use of number lines, and concrete and pictorial models.*

A72F9118992747F8899D22F9F2314A20.description:
Estimate and determine the percent represented by a given model (e.g., number line, picture,
verbal description), including percents greater than 100% and less than 1%.*

BBB590803C7F47B88C4ABD0B5EE58D35.description:
The student will reason and use multiple strategies to express equivalency, compare,
and order numbers written as fractions, mixed numbers, decimals, and percents.
